business.headline: GST rates slashed: Big relief for common man; cars, TVs, food items cheaperUnion Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced a major GST overhaul following a council meeting, terming it a structural reform for "ease of living".

5% and 18% GST slabs retained, 40% slab for sin goodsGST tax rates on common use items ranging from hair oil to corn flakes, TVs, and personal health and life insurance policies were slashed after the all-powerful GST Council on Wednesday approved a complete overhaul of the tangled Goods and Services Tax regime.

Can GST reforms be a game changer? Montek Singh Ahluwalia respondsIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV, former Planning Commission Deputy Chairperson Dr Montek Singh Ahluwalia talked about upcoming GST reforms and pitched for a 14% single rate formula.

GST 2.0 approved: What gets cheaper and costlier from September 22?The 56th meeting of the GST Council approved the abolition of the 12% and 28% slabs, streamlining the regime into just two standard rates – 5% and 18%. A new 40% slab has also been introduced for sin and luxury goods. The reforms will take effect from September 22, the first day of Navratri.

GST 2.0: Check the complete list of goods under 40% sin taxThe new system, called GST 2.0, introduces a simpler two-slab structure and makes several changes to the way goods are taxed. These changes will take effect from 22 September 2025.

No GST on life and health insurance premiums from September 22After the 56th GST Council meeting, Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced that insurance services, which currently attract 18% GST, will now be fully exempt.

GST on TVs, ACs slashed from 28% to 18%: Nirmala Sitharaman after 56th council meetThe new rates, which include a reduction from 28% to 18% for TVs larger than 32 inches, will come into effect from September 22.

GST 2.0 cuts prices on TVs, cement, bikes; milk, paneer now tax-free. Check full listHouseholds stand to benefit the most, as a host of everyday items have seen major reductions. Hair oil, toilet soaps, shampoos, toothbrushes and bicycles will now attract just 5% GST, down from 18%.

New GST regime from Sept 22: 5% and 18% slabs remain, 40% on luxury goodsThe Council cleared a two-tier tax structure with rates of 5 per cent and 18 per cent, along with a new 40 per cent slab for sin and luxury goods. The decision will come into effect from September 22, Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced.

Amanta Healthcare IPO booked 80x: Check GMP, subscription status on final dayAmanta Healthcare launched its book-built issue of Rs 126 crore, entirely a fresh issue of 1 crore shares. The bidding window opened on September 1 and closed on September 3.
Gold vs stock market: Where should you put your money now?Market expert explained that gold and silver are usually considered when there is fear of a big market collapse.

Jane Street appeals against Sebi's market banThe dispute began in July when Sebi temporarily restricted Jane Street from trading in Indian markets. The regulator had accused the firm of manipulating key stock indexes, one of its strongest actions against a foreign investor in recent years.

entertainment.headline: Director Raj Nidimoru's ex-wife shares new cryptic post after Samantha's viral reelActor Samantha Ruth Prabhu's recent Dubai reel once again stirred rumours about her relationship with director Raj Nidimoru. His ex-wife Shhyamali De shared cryptic Instagram stories, adding fuel to the speculation.

TV actor Ashish Kapoor arrested on rape charges in PuneTelevision actor Ashish Kapoor was arrested on rape charges after a woman, who met him through Instagram, accused him of sexually assaulting her during a house party in Delhi.

Ranveer cheers as Deepika becomes 1st Indian jury member for Louis Vuitton PrizeActor Deepika Padukone became the first Indian jury member for Louis Vuitton Prize 2025. Her actor-husband Ranveer Singh posted an adorable comment on her recent post from the event.

Anupam Kher shares magical encounter with Shreya Ghoshal and MM KeeravaaniAnupam Kher shared a touching video of his "magical encounter" with Shreya Ghoshal and MM Keeravaani, where the duo's impromptu singing left fans mesmerised.

Sanjay Leela Bhansali to film Love & War climax in Sicily, ItalySanjay Leela Bhansali will shoot the climax of 'Love & War' in Sicily, Italy, featuring Ranbir Kapoor, Alia Bhatt, and Vicky Kaushal. The film is scheduled for a release on March 20, 2026.

Samay Raina and Anurag Kashyap break the internet with new condom adComedian Samay Raina has made waves in Indian advertising with a bold condom-branded campaign featuring filmmaker Anurag Kashyap. The ad's unapologetic tone and witty banter have resonated with audiences.

Ahan Shetty on nepotism: Being Suniel's son brings both privilege and pressureAhan Shetty admitted that being Suniel Shetty's son gives him opportunities but also brings higher expectations and scrutiny.

Nishaanchi trailer: Anurag Kashyap unleashes mayhem with mafia, politics and rivalryThe trailer of director Anurag Kashyap's 'Nishaanchi' shows debutant Aaishvary Thackeray in a double-role. The film is set in the hinterlands of Uttar Pradesh from the early 2000s.

Real-life story of Inspector Zende, the man who nabbed Charles Sobhraj twiceNetflix's 'Inspector Zende' brings to life the story of Mumbai cop Madhukar Zende who captured serial killer Charles Sobhraj twice. Here's all you need to know about the former police officer.

Shah Rukh Khan prays for strength, stands with Punjab amid flood crisisShah Rukh Khan has come forward to support Punjab amid severe floods causing widespread devastation. Sharing a post on Instagram on Wednesday, the superstar prayed for strength.

My Life With Walter Boys 2 review: Love, loss and Cole's rise as the real heroRelease Date:Thu Aug 28, 2025Netflix's teen drama 'My Life With Walter Boys Season 2' takes Jackie's story forward with more heartbreak, complicated romances, and the ever-intense love triangle between Alex and Cole.

Disha Vakani, Taarak Mehta's Dayaben, makes rare public appearance at LalbaugchaDisha Vakani made a rare appearance at Mumbai's Lalbaugcha Raja during Ganesh Utsav, sparking fan excitement. Away from television since 2018, her return remains uncertain as the show's creator cites her family commitments.

28 Years Later The Bone Temple trailer: Humans fight against virus, zombiesDirector Nia DaCosta's '28 Years Later: The Bone Temple' has resumed the epic saga with new dangers. The post-apocalyptic film is the third instalment in the coming-of-age horror series.

Andhera actor Karanvir Malhotra reveals working like an office boy in MelbourneActor Karanvir Malhotra, in an exclusive interaction, spoke about his initial career struggles. He recalled putting up posters outside grocery stores in Melbourne.

Ranvir Shorey advises against dating, refers to Meghalaya honeymoon murderActor Ranvir Shorey recently expressed his views on the current dating trends. The actor stated that this is not the right time to invest in relationships.

Gauahar Khan, Zaid Darbar announce birth of second child, a baby boyActor Gauahar Khan and her husband Zaid Darbar welcomed their second child on September 1. The couple shared the news with a joint post on social media.

Vivek Agnihotri recalls working with Irrfan in debut film Chocolate: I miss himFilmmaker Vivek Agnihotri recalled working with Irrfan Khan in his debut film 'Chocolate', praising the late actor's spontaneous style and unique screen presence. He also shared memories of Irrfan's off-set persona.

Baseer-Farhana's fight-to-flirt chemistry is the spicy twist Bigg Boss 19 neededBaseer Ali Khan and Farhana Bhatt's fiery clashes in 'Bigg Boss 19' are slowly giving way to flirtatious banter and unexpected chemistry. And we are in for it with popcorn!

Bridgerton's Simone Ashley kiss with mystery man at US Open, pics go viralHollywood star Simone Ashley once again made headlines for her personal life after being seen sharing a kiss with a mystery man at the US Open.

general news.headline: New GST regime from Sept 22: 5% and 18% slabs remain, 40% on luxury goodsThe Council cleared a two-tier tax structure with rates of 5 per cent and 18 per cent, along with a new 40 per cent slab for sin and luxury goods. The decision will come into effect from September 22, Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced.

GST rate cuts will benefit common man, farmers, MSMEs: PM Modi welcomes reformsPM Modi welcomed the introduction of the new two-tier GST structure and said that the move would benefit farmers, MSMEs, middle class, women and youth.

No GST on life and health insurance premiums from September 22After the 56th GST Council meeting, Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced that insurance services, which currently attract 18% GST, will now be fully exempt.

Lisbon landmark streetcar crash kills 15, injures 18, Portugal declares mourningA historic Lisbon streetcar derailed on Wednesday, killing 15 people and injuring 18. Authorities declared a national day of mourning after Portugal's worst recent accident shook its capital city.

GST 2.0 cuts prices on TVs, cement, bikes; milk, paneer now tax-free. Check full listHouseholds stand to benefit the most, as a host of everyday items have seen major reductions. Hair oil, toilet soaps, shampoos, toothbrushes and bicycles will now attract just 5% GST, down from 18%.

US Open Live: Swiatek in action, Felix storms into semis after epic de MinaurUS Open 2025, Day 11 Live Updates: Felix Auger-Aliassime stormed into the men's singles semi-final after a four-hour epic battle with Alex di Minaur. Iga Swiatek will be taking on Amanda Anisimova in the women's singles quarterfinals to start things off. Meanwhile, Jannik Sinner will be in action later on as he takes on Lorenzo Musetti.

GST 2.0: Check the complete list of goods under 40% sin taxThe new system, called GST 2.0, introduces a simpler two-slab structure and makes several changes to the way goods are taxed. These changes will take effect from 22 September 2025.

Jarange-Patil fast folds up, but can Fadnavis douse the simmering Maratha fire?Manoj Jarange-Patil's mass mobilisation in Mumbai got over with the Mahayuti regime ceding some ground, but the wider question of social acceptance of CM Devendra Fadnavis lingers

Kim Jong Un's aides erased DNA after talks with Putin? Video sparks buzzThe unusual spectacle unfolded on Wednesday, shortly after the North Korean and Russian leaders held talks following a grand military parade in Beijing, where Chinese President Xi Jinping showcased his nation's growing diplomatic clout.

Trump snaps at Polish reporter, cites India sanctions as action against RussiaTrump's remarks came during a bilateral meeting in the Oval Office with Polish President Karol Nawrocki. Trump appeared visibly irked when a Polish reporter questioned him about showing frustration with Russian President Vladimir Putin but not taking action.

GST on TVs, ACs slashed from 28% to 18%: Nirmala Sitharaman after 56th council meetThe new rates, which include a reduction from 28% to 18% for TVs larger than 32 inches, will come into effect from September 22.

Has Jarange Patil really won the Maratha quota battle?Maratha quota activist Manoj Jarange Patil called the Maharashtra government's nod to accord the Kunbi status a breakthrough. However, the gains are narrowly tailored for only those Marathas with traceable records and would leave out millions. Is this victory big enough for Patil, who was turned away empty-handed several times?
Bengaluru couple spends Rs 5.9 lakh monthly, shares expense list in viral videoIn a now-viral video, a Bengaluru-based couple broke down their expenses for the month of August in detail.

37 dead, over 3.5 lakh impacted as Punjab sees worst floods since 1988Ongoing floods in Punjab have claimed 37 lives, as continued heavy rainfall and rising river levels disrupt daily life across several districts. The worst-affected districts include Gurdaspur, Pathankot, Fazilka, Kapurthala, Tarn Taran, Ferozepur, Hoshiarpur and Amritsar.

India kills us with tariffs: Trump repeats claim of 'no duty' offer from New DelhiDonald Trump claimed that India, like China and Brazil, "kills" the US with tariffs. He said that the tariff gives the US "tremendous negotiating power."

Asia Cup: South Korea halts India's momentum with 2-2 draw in rain-hit Super 4s openerHockey Asia Cup: India's winning momentum at the Asia Cup 2025 came to an end as Korea held them to a 2-2 draw in Rajgir. Hardik and Mandeep Singh's goals helped India gain a valuable point in the end.

Maruti Suzuki Victoris unveiled: New mid-size SUV with 5-Star BNCAP Rating, ADASMaruti Suzuki has unveiled the Victoris, a new mid-size SUV for its Arena network. Positioned above the Brezza and Grand Vitara, it boasts premium features, multiple powertrains, and a 5-star BNCAP rating.

'Longer you live...': Hot mic catches Putin, Xi musing on immortality, Kim looks onA hot microphone captured a rare unscripted exchange between Russian President Vladimir Putin and Chinese President Xi Jinping — a conversation about organ transplants, longevity, and even the prospect of immortality.

Heavy rain and waterlogging batter Delhi-NCR, Yamuna continues to swellThe water level of River Yamuna in Delhi rose to 207.33 meters by 6 pm on Wednesday, becoming the third-highest level ever recorded in the city's history. Floodwaters also entered relief camps in the Yamuna Bazaar area by evening, prompting evacuations.

How Pinarayi Vijayan is covering all the bases for 2026 Kerala pollsKerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan and the incumbent LDF are strategising how to negate anti-incumbency while pushing the development narrative and consolidating vote-banks

My Life With Walter Boys 2 review: Love, loss and Cole's rise as the real heroRelease Date:Thu Aug 28, 2025Netflix's teen drama 'My Life With Walter Boys Season 2' takes Jackie's story forward with more heartbreak, complicated romances, and the ever-intense love triangle between Alex and Cole.

Conspiracies against me: K Kavitha quits BRS, drops bombshells after suspensionK Kavitha resigned from her MLC post a day after being suspended from the party, intensifying the turmoil within the KCR-led outfit. She accused her cousins Harish Rao and Santosh Kumar of conspiring against her father, weakening the party, and plotting to divide their family.

Why North Korea's Kim prefers his slow-moving train for trips, what's inside?North Korea's leader Kim Jong Un prefers his slow-moving, green armoured train, The Sun, because it is far safer than the country's aging planes. It doubles as a secure office on wheels, and continues a family tradition from his grandfather's time. It even has space to carry his luxury limousines.

TV actor Ashish Kapoor arrested on rape charges in PuneTelevision actor Ashish Kapoor was arrested on rape charges after a woman, who met him through Instagram, accused him of sexually assaulting her during a house party in Delhi.

sports.headline: US Open: Four years felt like a lifetime, Canada's Felix back in Grand Slam semisFelix Auger-Aliassime has reached the US Open semifinals after a thrilling comeback against Alex de Minaur. His win boosts hopes for a strong finish at the ATP Finals and marks a significant return to form.

Suruchi Inder Singh tops ISSF 10m air pistol rankings, Manu Bhaker slips to sixthIndian teen shooter Suruchi Inder Singh climbed to world No.1 in the ISSF women's 10m air pistol rankings, overtaking Chinese rivals after a stellar season. Double Olympic medallist Manu Bhaker, meanwhile, secured the sixth spot.

Julien Nagelsmann sets bold target as Germany eye 2026 World Cup gloryJulien Nagelsmann set out his target with the German national team eyeing their fifth World Cup title in 2026 as they prepare for their qualifying campaign against Slovakia

Bayer Levekusen eye Ange Postecoglou as next manager after Erik ten Hag disasterAnge Postecoglou is back in the spotlight as Bayer Leverkusen and Fenerbahce, fresh off sacking ex-Manchester United bosses Erik ten Hag and Jose Mourinho, consider the former Tottenham Hotspur manager for their high-stakes rebuilding projects in Europe.

Asia Cup: South Korea halts India's momentum with 2-2 draw in rain-hit Super 4s openerHockey Asia Cup: India's winning momentum at the Asia Cup 2025 came to an end as Korea held them to a 2-2 draw in Rajgir. Hardik and Mandeep Singh's goals helped India gain a valuable point in the end.

Kamindu Mendis guides Sri Lanka to thrilling T20 win over ZimbabweKamindu Mendis' late innings helped Sri Lanka recover from a collapse to win the opening T20I against Zimbabwe in Harare. The victory puts Sri Lanka 1-0 up in the series, leaving Zimbabwe to regret missed chances in a closely fought contest.

Imane Khelif to miss World Championships amid sex testing eligibility rowAlgerian boxer Imane Khelif will not compete at the World Boxing Championships in Liverpool due to ongoing disputes over mandatory genetic sex testing. The controversy raises questions about fairness and inclusion in female boxing competitions.

South Africa pick 17-year-old Karabo Meso in Women's ODI World Cup squadSouth Africa have named 17-year-old Karabo Meso in their 15-member World Cup squad. The team aims to blend youth and experience to make a strong title push in India and Sri Lanka.

Iga Swiatek will be taking on Amanda Anisimova in the women's singles quarterfinals to start things off. Meanwhile, Jannik Sinner will be in action later on as he takes on Lorenzo Musetti.

Pat Cummins ready to risk it all to get fit by Ashes: Willing to take a few risksAustralia captain Pat Cummins vows to push his limits to recover from a back injury and be fit for the Ashes 2025 opener against England in Perth, determined not to miss the iconic Test series.

High-stakes BCCI AGM to decide new president, IPL chairman in SeptemberThe BCCI Annual General Meeting in September will decide new office bearers including president and IPL chairman. The leadership changes come amid mandatory cooling-off rules and potential impact of the National Sports Governance Act.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
